instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - USB Port Doesn't work
threads.message:
Hi, i need your help, guys!
Here is the thing: I get light in the mouse (both port). However, the USB port doesn't work.
Do you guys have any advice/hint ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - USB Port Doesn't work
threads.message: Any history liquid etc? Very common for both L4600 and L4610 to fail, so I'd say replace both of those and go from there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - USB Port Doesn't work
threads.message:
None of USB ports works?
Then could be PCH issue.
Check resistance to ground and compare values on data lines.

Apart of L4600/10 there is <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> (one port only), which can be removed; need to mount <RESISTOR>R4651</RESISTOR>/52 then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - USB Port Doesn't work
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - USB Port Doesn't work
threads.message: Replace L4600/10. Also please don't use comments as we don't see them.
